meanings.definition: Contaminated with a substance that can cause illness or death.
meanings.sent1: The poisoned apple made Snow White very sick.
meanings.sent2: The warning label on the bottle of bleach said, 'Do not drink, it is poisoned.'
meanings.sent3: The cat looked suspiciously at the poisoned fish, wondering if it was a trick.
meanings.sent4: The poisoned atmosphere in the room made everyone feel uneasy.
meanings.sent5: The smell of the poisoned food was enough to make anyone nauseous.

meanings.definition: Having been harmed or corrupted by a toxic substance.
meanings.sent1: The poisoned tree slowly withered away in the polluted soil.
meanings.sent2: The poisoned mind of the villain led to their downfall.
meanings.sent3: The detective found a clue in the poisoned letter that cracked the case.
meanings.sent4: Her heart felt like a poisoned well, tainted by past betrayals.
meanings.sent5: The poisoned relationship between the two countries led to conflict.
